issue.title: [C++] random::RandomArrayGenerator::Boolean "probability" misdocumented / incorrect
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-9142](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-9142). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I would expect `rng.Boolean(length, 0.99)` to generate an array that is 99% "true" on average. 

The docs say "/// \param[in] probability the estimated number of active bits", but this is not what the function does (the opposite, actually).
